intro: Merremia weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer morning glory, is a flowering vine native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from purple to blue. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, dry seeds. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and forest edges. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in some areas.
